questions.question: Java is a ______ Oriented language
questions.hint: Java works around structures called objects

questions.question: The correct syntax to print hello world is: A. Print(hello world) B. Print(“Hello world”); C. System.out(“Hello world”); D. System.out.print(“Hello world”)
questions.hint: You want to call the Systems “out” method and “print” it to the console

questions.question: What primitive data structure holds a non-floating point number?
questions.hint: The primitive for an integer

questions.question: When writing a String backslash-____ is an escape sequence for a new line A. u, B. q C. n D. s
questions.hint: To call a new line, you’d want to use this escape character

questions.question: Java runs on the Java ____ Machine A. Virtual B. Async C. Old D. Digital
questions.hint: Java is run using a virtualized machine

questions.question: Java was developed at a company called ___ Microsystems
questions.hint: Some might say this company rose everyday, much like something in the sky

questions.question: A line of java ends with a: A. ; B. > C. // D. =
questions.hint: You use this when the line is complete, not when its “semi” done

questions.question: When a double is converted to an int, it is round in which direction?
questions.hint: Which way is the ground?

questions.question: Question: To make a comment in java, you would use: A. <! B. // C. – D. ~
questions.hint: This would “slash” out the comment

questions.question: In a method header, the  ____ keyword indicates that the method will not return anything
questions.hint: It will return void

questions.question: To increment the variable: int i=0; you would use: A. i++; B. I add C. I inc; D. I+2;
questions.hint: ++ adds one to a value

questions.question: The modulus operator returns the _____
questions.hint: It is not the Quotient

questions.question: A function in Java is referred to as a _____
questions.hint: It is a “method” of doing something

questions.question: Java is a _____ threaded language A. Hard B. Single C. Invisible D. Multi
questions.hint: Java can use “multi”ple threads

questions.question: The assignment operator in Java is: A. – B. ~ C. = D. .
questions.hint: Remember to drink vitamin C

questions.question: In java, arrays start an an index of: __
questions.hint: The number zero

questions.question: To multiply two numbers, you would use the __ operator
questions.hint: It is not “x”

questions.question: From the Java Standard Library, you would use the ____ keyword to add it to your project A. Import B. Pkg C. Add D. Library
questions.hint: You need to import it

questions.question: To initialize an array you would declare the type and this operator: A. { } B. [ ] C. < > D. = =
questions.hint: An array could be kept in a square

questions.question: To create a new Java class, you would use the keyword _____
questions.hint: You may have learned this in class

questions.question: An acceptable declaration of an array using Go is: A. array[5] integers B. var arr [10]string C. string[5]; d. 5 string[]
questions.hint: Arrays get declared as a var first

questions.question: What is the operator to decrement a number by one?
questions.hint: It is the same as the decrement operator in java

questions.question: What is the keyword to add a package to a golang file?
questions.hint: Similar to buying a foreign object and shipping it to the United States, you have to import it

questions.question: What is the package that must be importted to use any formatted I/O with golang? A. string B. io C. String D. fmt
questions.hint: How could you abbreviate formatted?

questions.question: What is the keyword to declare a function?
questions.hint: Abbreviate the word function

questions.question: The return type of a function comes before or after the function name and parameters?
questions.hint: It does not come before

questions.question: What package has to be imported to get the current time? A. time B. clock C. Sundial D. Hourglass
questions.hint: You only need to get the time

questions.question: What is the operator to increment a number by one?
questions.hint: It is the same as the increment operator in java

questions.question: The type of parameter comes after or before the variables name?
questions.hint: It is not before

questions.question: What is the operator for a short assignment? A. := B. = C. == D. ===
questions.hint: It uses a colon

questions.question: What is the modulus operator? A. & B. % C. @ D. /
questions.hint: It is the same as the modulus operator in java

questions.question: What is the basic type of a variable that can only be true or false? A. boolean B. bool C. truefalse D. bit
questions.hint: How could you abbreviate boolean?

questions.question: An int declared but not initlaized is given a value of: A. 0 B. zero C. null d. one
questions.hint: An int is numeric

questions.question: The loop supported by golang is a ___ loop
questions.hint: It is a loop supported in java and not a while loop

questions.question: A statement with cases is called a ______ statement
questions.hint: It is the same as it is in java

questions.question: An If statement needs to be surrounded by: A. () B. // C. <> D. {}
questions.hint: Only curly braces are required

questions.question: A _____ statement makes the function wait until the function it is within runs first
questions.hint: It needs to be deferred

questions.question: A _______ holds the memory address of a value?
questions.hint: It is the same as in C

questions.question: What is a collection of fields, similar to an object, in golang?
questions.hint: It is the same as in C

questions.question: Golang was created at which popular tech company?
questions.hint: Think of the first two letters of golang and your most used search engine
